title: so are strategy loops for surviving for practically forever in survival games normal
body:
in don't starve i took on a strategy from someone else of getting everything you need, then going for spider silk, finding a good spot around beehives, then making a beekeeper hat where you can then go kill all the bees (except the yellow ones), then the hive, take the honey/honeycomb, and finally with a few other things which are easy to get, along with capturing some bees, you make bee boxes, lots of them, take their honey when the bees are done doing their thing, and eat the honey to restore hunger/health

i've made it 21 days so far (last time my highest was 8 days) and here i can play the game forever at this rate because i can sustain myself to the highest no matter what because of honey and i have trees all around me so i can keep planting more with pinecones and use them for boards and stuff

still

sanity can be restored by flowers and those are everywhere

so now i can just use this strategy and live forever unless some crazy thing comes over and one-hit kills me

i mean i did see a tree man, but he's slow as shit so i just outran him

anyway

this seems like a thing in survival games

there's always that strategy that makes the game easy because there's no way you can die under normal circumstances and it's a loop because you can repeat it for an infinite amount of time without any trouble

even more so i'm already in winter and nothing really seems to be bothering me

but it could be that i'm playing the regular version not the reign of giants version (which is more difficult)
